abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes one for the history books--St Louis Cardinals triumph in the National League Championship Series is the first postseason series in which the winning team did not keep a starting pitcher past the fifth inning.
snippet: The Cardinals’ N.L.C.S. triumph was the first postseason series in which the winning team did not have a starter pitch past the fifth inning.
lead_paragraph: The Cardinals’ N.L.C.S. triumph was the first postseason series in which the winning team did not have a starter pitch past the fifth inning.

headline.main: A Gritty Bullpen of Fierce Creatures
headline.print_headline: A Gritty Bullpen Of Fierce Creatures
headline.seo: 2011 N.L.C.S.: For St. Louis, a Nutty Way to Win, and Don’t Forget the Squirrel
